content:
If they are stored as .eml files and your computer is set up to open .eml files using Thunderbird. Then you can read them using Thunderbird.

However, if you are thinking of changing provider and want to keep copies of emails, then create some folders in 'Local Folders' mail account and use 'right click on highlighted email and select 'Copy to' and choose relevant folder in 'Local Folders' mail account. Check you really have a full copy; you can read emails stored in 'Local Folders'.

Basically, you do not have to save emails as .eml files to a folder outside of Thunderbird if you are going to stop using that particular email address.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
You can only modify a password via the webmail account accessed via a browser.

If you do not know password, then use the 'forgotten Pasword' link and follow instructions to get access to webmail account. Once you have reset/modified password, then you need to update the one stored in Thunderbird, assuming you do allow Thunderbird to store passwords.

In Thunderbird

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • scroll to 'Passwords' section
  • clickon 'Saved Passwords'
  • click on 'Show Passwords'
  • Select each relevant line there will one for incoming and one fior outgoing.
  • Right click on line and select 'Edit Password'
  • Completely clear contents and carefully type in the new password.
  • click on 'Close'

REstart Thunderbird.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Please note neither Mozilla nor Thunderbird endorses the product mentioned above. Try it at your own risk.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
The image on the right shows you are using a new supernova 115* version. There are two setting you can try.

Suggest you enable the Menu Bar as it will make life a lot easier. Menu app > View > Toolbars > select Menu Bar

Then increase the space between items: View > Density > select 'Default' or 'Relaxed'

You can also choose to increase the size of the font: View > Font Size > select 'Increase Font size' You may need to select this more than once to get desired size.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Are you trying to upload mail from Local Folders to a folder on the gmail server? That's not as straightforward as it appears:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1331879

You might have better luck by setting the new account to collect mail from the other account, through the gmail website.

Also, an add-on isn't needed to import mbox files to TB Local Folders, although for TB 115 there is one.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1417914
creator: sfhowes

content: Downgrading is not recommended unless as a last resort. See this post re IET NG.

content: Try this: right-click the account in the Folder Pane, Properties, Repair Folder, to rebuild the message index.
